title: Captcha for "unusual traffic" for Google Searches
content:
Every few Google searches, I get an unsual traffic message with a captcha to prove I'm human. This only happens with Google searches and I don't have the same issue on Chrome or Safari (I'm on a Mac). This only began about two months ago.

It's driving me nuts. I love so many things about Firefox, but this has been going on for months, and I'm about to give up. I found some "solutions" about privacy settings, but none of them have worked so far. I have changed IpV6 settings, privacy settings in about:config, and proxy settings in Firefox. Nothing has stopped it.

This only happens when I search on Google. It seems clear to me that Google and Firefox are not playing well together.

Is anybody else still experiencing this? Has anyone found a solution other than what I've noted above?

title: Web sites hanging and not loading properly on Firefox
content:
I've used Firefox for 20 years through the various iterations of Windows, and have been using it trouble free on Windows 11 since November 2024. Two days ago, however, When I tried to open the Guardian site (www.theguardian.com) it would open very slowly and not load and of the pictures. This gradually got worse, the site taking for ever to open at all, and always with the little dot in the tab at the top left going from side to side showing it was still loading. I have tried everything I can think of. Opened in troubleshoot mode, changed DNS settings, uninstalled and reinstalled Firefox twice (one time to see if it would work normally if I didn't actually sign in to my account). All to no avail. In fact now things are worse, in that the GOV.Uk website is now giving me similar problems - and a few other sites have become slightly slow and reluctant to open as well. My internet connection seems fine, and all these sites open without any trouble on Microsoft Edge. I am NOT very good at tech, and I am now tearing my heair out as to what I can try next.

Any help wopuld be gratefully received!

Jim Luetchford

title: Firefox non si avvia
content:
Buongiorno, sto riscontrando un problema persistente con Firefox su Windows: il browser non si avvia. Quando provo ad aprirlo, il cursore indica un caricamento per qualche secondo, ma la finestra non compare e il processo si chiude senza messaggi di errore.

Dettagli importanti: - Firefox non crea alcuna cartella in %APPDATA%\Mozilla, dopo reinstallazione - Il processo firefox.exe compare brevemente e poi scompare - Non viene mostrato alcun errore a schermo

Tentativi già effettuati (tutti senza successo): - Disinstallazione completa e reinstallazione pulita - Rimozione manuale di eventuali residui (Program Files, AppData, LocalAppData) - Verifica che Firefox non risulti più installato - Avvio come amministratore - Avvio con parametri (firefox -P, firefox -safe-mode) - Controllo e disattivazione temporanea di antivirus / Windows Defender - Verifica Accesso controllato alle cartelle (ransomware protection) - Controllo che non esistano profili o file di lock - Riavvio del sistema dopo ogni operazione

Il problema si presenta anche al primo avvio, prima che venga creato qualsiasi profilo utente.

Aggiungo che la problematica descritta si è presentata su 3 altri pc.

Grazie per l’attenzione e il supporto.

title: VoiceOver commands not working on Mac
content:
Hi I use VoiceOver on my Mac to type quickly and it is integral for my day-to-day tasks. However, I encounter an issue when using certain commands to make selections and subsequent corrections to things I type in a text field.

A brief explanation of VoiceOver I am having issue with I speak "select previous word/sentence/paragraph" etc. (anything that isn't x letters) the command is not executed properly.

To be completely honest the commands are unpredicatble and more often than not select commands do not work.

So if I am searching something on google and VoiceOver mistypes or mishears something I need to manually go back and correct it, this is a big accesibility issue and it's a shame because I love firefox, however this is a major accesibility issue for me.
